articles.author: Nandita Bose, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Trump also asserted that Musk's blistering attacks on the bill were motivated by the proposed elimination of consumer tax credits for electric vehicles.
articles.title: Trump attacks Musk as public feud escalates over tax-cut bill

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Reuters video showed smoke billowing from the area after the first strikes on the Hezbollah stronghold in over a month.
articles.title: Israeli military strikes Beirut's southern suburbs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drones attacked Ukraine's capital Kyiv early on Friday, triggering fires in residential buildings in different parts of the city, authorities said.
articles.title: Russian drones attack Kyiv, trigger fires in residential areas, officials say

articles.author: Nate Raymond, Steve Gorman, Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: District Judge Allison Burroughs enjoined Trump's proclamation from taking effect pending further litigation.
articles.title: Trump ban on entry of international Harvard students blocked by US judge

articles.author: Kantaro Komiya
articles.description: Japanese company ispace said its uncrewed moon lander likely crashed onto the moon's surface during its lunar touchdown attempt on Friday, marking another failure two years after its unsuccessful inaugural mission.
articles.title: Japan moon-landing attempt: Tokyo-based ispace loses communication with Resilience lander

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer's Labour Party won a surprise victory in a fiercely fought by-election for the Scottish parliament on Friday after one of the most bitter election campaigns in the country's recent history.
articles.title: In surprise victory, UK's Labour wins Scottish by-election after bitter contest

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: An Australian woman accused of the murder of three elderly relatives of her estranged husband by feeding them poisonous mushrooms said it was possible she had searched for lethal death cap mushrooms on her computer, a court heard on Friday.
articles.title: Erin Patterson: mushroom murders accused searched for deadly strain before deaths, court hears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military recovered the bodies of two hostages, Judi Weinstein-Haggai and Gad Haggai, who were held by Hamas, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli military recovers bodies of two hostages held by Hamas, prime minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in India's tech capital of Bengaluru have arrested four people, including an official of a top cricket franchise, in connection with a stampede during a trophy celebration that killed 11 people and injured 47, media reported.
articles.title: Indian police arrest four people for cricket fans stampede

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and U.S. President Donald Trump are in direct communication as part of Ottawa's bid to persuade Washington to lift tariffs, Industry Minister Melanie Joly said on Thursday.
articles.title: Trump and Carney are in direct contact over tariffs, says Canadian minister
